H0.text: Which rust free cars were built in Dunmurry, Northern Ireland in the late 1970s. Lotus Esprit

H1.text: Which rust free cars were built in Dunmurry, Northern Ireland in the late 1970s. Triumph TR7

H2.text: Which rust free cars were built in Dunmurry, Northern Ireland in the late 1970s. Austin Allegro

H3.text: Which rust free cars were built in Dunmurry, Northern Ireland in the late 1970s. DeLorean

A4.text: The body is paneled in brushed austenitic SAE 304 stainless steel.

A5.text: Production at the Dunmurry factory, located a few miles from Belfast City Centre, finally began in late 1980.

A6.text: The DeLorean was produced at the Dunmurry facility in Northern Ireland from early 1981 to late 1982.

A7.text: The DeLorean was manufactured from early 1981 to late 1982.

A8.text: DeLorean Motor Company, former automobile manufacturer, headquartered in North America

A9.text: DeLorean Motor Company was headquartered in North America

A10.text: Dunmurry was the location of the DeLorean Motor Company factory where the DeLorean sports car was manufactured from 1981 until 1982.

A11.text: The DeLorean was famously featured in the Back to the Future movie trilogy.

A12.text: Stainless steel's resistance to corrosion comes from its chromium content of 10.5% or more, which forms a passive film that protects the material and can self-heal when exposed to oxygen.

A13.text: This passive film prevents further corrosion by blocking oxygen diffusion to the steel surface and thus prevents corrosion from spreading into the bulk of the metal.
